trends: There have been 42 other sightings in Lincoln
There were no other sightings in Lincoln on or around November 23rd 2007
Summary: Arrow shaped black spots covered with orange glow moving north to south.
divs: sighting detailsi was sitting in my bavkyard hottub on cold cloudless night. as i was looking up to the north (at about 8:15pm) i noticed a faint orange glowing cloud, like the glow from the interstate lights. behind the moving cloud (going south) were black spots\lines forming an arrow pointing south. between the arrow were diagonal black lines crisscrossing between the arrow. every 5-10 seconds, the diagonal lines turned to scattered black spots, then back to diagonals, etc. at first i was thinking it looked ike a flock of geese but knew after watching a definite pattern of thecdiagonal lines turning to scattered and back that geese do not have patterns that changed back and forth every few seconds unless a person was concentrating on the sky as i was, it wouldn't be noticeble. the cloud of cream\orange moved with the object like camoflauge at what seemed around 20,000 -30,000 feet i'm air. i know it was solid because it blocked out the stars as it moved and thecorange cloud moved exactly with black spots to keep it covered up. i lost it from sight when it was far enough south to be covered by my tree. i estimate it took about 3 minutes to cover from north to south and there was no noise. i knew i did not have time to run into house and get a camera. i immediately called a friend to describe the object and told her to let me know if she heard any reports on tv. i've monitored the web and saw a similar report in canada and australia but notin the same time period. i also reported it on a local site that tracks ufo sightings. how i felt when i saw it was complete confidence that it was nothing i had ever seen before. i was nervous enough to immediately go inside, lock the doors and monitor the news and internet. it didn't surprise me that no one else saw it because the camoflauge was so faint in orange color that it almost completely blended into the sky. i wouldn't have notced if the black spots or lines wouldn't have penetrated through the glow. i remember we had an ice storm during the morning hours about 8 hours later. i had my annual eye checkup the next morning and was 20\20 without glasses.
